name: Erika's Oddish

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: When it is woken by moonlight, it wanders about. But during the day, it stays still underground.

name: Erika's Gloom

attacks.name: Poison Spray
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: It secretes a sticky, drool-like nectar. Though sweet, it smells too repulsive to get very close.

name: Erika's Vileplume ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Lovely Fragrance
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may use this Ability. Heal 30 damage from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Bloom Powder
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

name: Erika's Bellsprout
flavorText: Even though its body is extremely skinny, it is blindingly fast when catching its prey.

name: Erika's Weepinbell

attacks.name: Leafy Cyclone
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use attacks.

flavorText: It spits out Poison Powder to immobilize the enemy and then finishes it with a spray of Acid.

attacks.name: Flower Garden Rondo
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage for each of your Erika's Pokémon in play.

name: Erika's Tangela

abilities.name: Gathering of Blossoms
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may use this Ability. Search your deck for an Erika's Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Hidden beneath a tangle of vines that grows nonstop even if the vines are torn off, this Pokémon’s true appearance remains a mystery.

name: Chikorita

attacks.name: Growl
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, attacks used by the Defending Pokémon do 20 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: A sweet aroma gently wafts from the leaf on its head. It is docile and loves to soak up sun rays.

name: Mega Meganium ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Giant Bouquet
attacks.text: This attack does 50 more damage for each Grass Energy attached to this Pokémon.

name: Wurmple
flavorText: It loves to eat leaves. If it is attacked by a Starly, it will defend itself with its spiked rear.

name: Silcoon

abilities.name: Multiplying Cocoon
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may use this Ability. Search your deck for a Silcoon or a Cascoon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: It wraps silk around the branches of a tree. It drinks rainwater on its silk while awaiting evolution.

name: Beautifly

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Energy Straw
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand, and this attack does 80 damage for each Energy card you find there.

flavorText: Vibrantly patterned wings are its prominent feature. It sucks sweet flower nectar with its long mouth.

name: Cascoon

attacks.name: Trading Places
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

flavorText: Its body, which is made of soft silk, hardens over time. When cracks appear, evolution is near.

name: Dustox

abilities.name: Boisterous Wind
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may use this Ability. Flip a coin. If heads, put an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon into their hand.

attacks.name: Twilight Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

flavorText: A nocturnal Pokémon. Drawn by streetlights, they messily eat the leaves of trees lining boulevards.

name: Budew

attacks.name: Itchy Pollen
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, they can't play any Item cards from their hand.

flavorText: The pollen it releases contains poison. If this Pokémon is raised on clean water, the poison’s toxicity is increased.

name: Grubbin

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

flavorText: It spits sticky threads and winds them around branches, then swings nimbly from tree to tree in a pendulum-like motion.

name: Team Rocket's Tarountula

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: The ball of threads wrapped around its body is elastic enough to deflect the scythes of Scyther, this Pokémon’s natural enemy.

name: Team Rocket's Spidops

abilities.name: Charging Up
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may attach a Basic Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rocket Rush
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each of your Team Rocket's Pokémon in play.

flavorText: It clings to branches and ceilings using its threads and moves without a sound. It takes out its prey before the prey even notices it.

name: Charmander
flavorText: The flame on its tail indicates Charmander’s life force. If it is healthy, the flame burns brightly.

name: Charmeleon
flavorText: It lashes about with its tail to knock down its foe. It then tears up the fallen opponent with sharp claws.

name: Mega Charizard Y ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Explosion Y
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy from this Pokémon, and this attack does 280 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Ethan's Slugma
flavorText: Its lava body can cool and chip away at times, but a magma bath will heal it right up.

name: Ethan's Magcargo

abilities.name: Melt Away
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has no Energy attached, it has no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Lava Burst
attacks.text: Discard up to 5 Fire Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 70 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

flavorText: This Pokémon lives near the craters of volcanoes. It stores fire energy in its shell of cooled and hardened magma.

name: Entei

attacks.name: Flare Fall
attacks.text: If you have at least 4 Fire Energy in play, this attack does 90 more damage.

flavorText: A Pokémon that races across the land. It is said that one is born every time a new volcano appears.

name: Ethan's Ho-Oh ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Golden Flame
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may attach up to 2 Basic Fire Energy cards from your hand to 1 of your Benched Ethan's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Shining Feathers
attacks.text: Heal 50 damage from each of your Pokémon.

name: Numel

abilities.name: Incandescent Body
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Burned.

flavorText: The magma in its body reaches 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit. Its hump gets smaller when it uses Fire-type moves.

name: Camerupt

attacks.name: Roasting Burn
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon isn't Burned, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Power Stomp
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

flavorText: The volcanoes on its back have a major eruption every 10 years--or whenever it becomes really angry.

name: Tepig
flavorText: It can deftly dodge its foe’s attacks while shooting fireballs from its nose. It roasts berries before it eats them.

name: Pignite

attacks.name: Super Singe
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

flavorText: The more it eats, the more fuel it has to make the fire in its stomach stronger. This fills it with even more power.

name: Mega Emboar ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Crimson Blast
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 60 damage to itself.

name: N's Darumaka
flavorText: This popular symbol of good fortune will never fall over in its sleep, no matter how it’s pushed or pulled.

name: N's Darmanitan

attacks.name: Back Draft
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each Basic Energy card in your opponent's discard pile.

attacks.name: Flamebody Cannon
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon, and this attack also does 90 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: This Pokémon’s power level rises along with the temperature of its fire, which can reach 2,500 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Salandit

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

flavorText: Only female Salandit can produce gas laden with pheromones. Males entranced by this gas will do whatever the females tell them.

name: Salazzle

attacks.name: Sudden Scorching
attacks.text: Your opponent discards a card from their hand. If this Pokémon evolved from Salandit during this turn, your opponent discards 2 more cards.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

flavorText: When two Salazzle meet, they will use their pheromone gas to fight over the males in each other’s group.

name: Scorbunny

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

flavorText: Fire energy gathers in the pads of its feet, raising their temperature. Once hot, Scorbunny’s footpads can deal heavy damage to opponents.

name: Raboot
flavorText: While it prides itself on its varied kicking moves, it can also deliver powerful headbutts once its flames have heated up its forehead.

name: Cinderace ex
rules: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent’s).
Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Flare Strike
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Flare Strike.

attacks.name: Garnet Volley
attacks.text: This attack does 180 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Psyduck

abilities.name: Damp
abilities.text: Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) lose any Ability that requires the Pokémon using it to Knock Out itself.

flavorText: It is constantly wracked by a headache. When the headache turns intense, it begins using mysterious powers.

name: Golduck

abilities.name: Damp
abilities.text: Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) lose any Ability that requires the Pokémon using it to Knock Out itself.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

flavorText: When it swims at full speed using its long, webbed limbs, its forehead somehow begins to glow.

name: Totodile

attacks.name: Slight Intrusion
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: It is small but rough and tough. It won't hesitate to take a bite out of anything that moves.

name: Croconaw

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

flavorText: If it loses a fang, a new one grows back in its place. There are always 48 fangs lining its mouth.

name: Mega Feraligatr ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Mortal Crunch
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 200 more damage.

name: Sneasel

attacks.name: Beset
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

flavorText: This is a smart and sneaky Pokémon. A pair may work together to steal eggs by having one lure the parents away.

name: Weavile

attacks.name: Hail Claw
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon. Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: They travel in groups of four or five, leaving signs for one another on trees and rocks. They bring down their prey with coordinated attacks.

name: Snorunt
flavorText: In some snowy lands, certain folklore says a house will prosper if a Snorunt lives there.

name: Mega Froslass ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Resentful Refrain
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each card in your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Absolute Snow
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Regice ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Regi Charge
attacks.text: Attach up to 2 Basic Water Energy cards from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Ice Prison
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon, and your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: N's Vanillite

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: The temperature of their breath is -58 degrees Fahrenheit. They create snow crystals and make snow fall in the areas around them.

name: N's Vanillish

attacks.name: Sheer Cold
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't use attacks.

flavorText: They cool down the surrounding air and create ice particles, which they use to freeze their foes.

attacks.name: Snow Coating
attacks.text: Double the number of damage counters on each of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: This attack also does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Snom
flavorText: Within its internal organs, Snom amplifies the frigid air it gets from eating snow and then uses this amplified air to create icicle-like spikes.

name: Frosmoth

abilities.name: Alluring Wings
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may use this Ability. Each player draws a card.

attacks.name: Cold Cyclone
attacks.text: Move a Water Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

flavorText: It causes blizzards as it flies around with its huge, chill-emanating wings. Clean meltwater is its favorite thing to drink.

name: Glastrier

attacks.name: Ice Shot
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Frosty Typhoon
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Frosty Typhoon.

flavorText: Glastrier emits intense cold from its hooves. It’s also a belligerent Pokémon—anything it wants, it takes by force.

name: Raichu

attacks.name: Quick Blow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 more damage.

attacks.name: Strong Volt
attacks.text: Discard a Lightning Energy from this Pokémon.

flavorText: When its electricity builds, its muscles are stimulated, and it becomes more aggressive than usual.

name: Pikachu ex
rules: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent’s).
Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Resolute Heart
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has full HP and would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, it is not Knocked Out, and its remaining HP becomes 10.

attacks.name: Topaz Bolt
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Voltorb ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Hundred-Hitting Ball
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 100 more damage for each heads.

name: Tynamo

attacks.name: Hold Still
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

flavorText: While one alone doesn’t have much power, a chain of many Tynamo can be as powerful as lightning.

name: Eelektrik

abilities.name: Dynamotor
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may attach a Basic Lightning Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

flavorText: They coil around foes and shock them with electricity-generating organs that seem simply to be circular patterns.

name: Mega Eelektross ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Split Bomb
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage to each of 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Disaster Shock
attacks.text: You may discard 2 Lightning Energy from this Pokémon and make your opponent's Active Pokémon Paralyzed.

name: Stunfisk

attacks.name: Pouncing Trap
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat. During your next turn, the Defending Pokémon takes 100 more damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: It conceals itself in the mud of the seashore. Then it waits. When prey touch it, it delivers a jolt of electricity.

name: Helioptile
flavorText: The frills on either side of its head have cells that generate electricity when exposed to sunlight.

name: Heliolisk

abilities.name: Frilled Generator
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if you played Canari from your hand this turn, you may use this Ability. Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Lightning Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Powerful Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 70 damage for each heads.

flavorText: They flare their frills and generate energy. A single Heliolisk can generate sufficient electricity to power a skyscraper.

name: Charjabug
flavorText: While its durable shell protects it from attacks, Charjabug strikes at enemies with jolts of electricity discharged from the tips of its jaws.

name: Vikavolt

attacks.name: Volt Switch
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Lightning Pokémon.

flavorText: When carrying a Charjabug, Vikavolt can receive electricity from it and then rapidly fire powerful electromagnetic beams from its large jaws.

name: Tapu Koko

attacks.name: Fast Flight
attacks.text: If you go first, you can use this attack during your first turn. Discard your hand and draw 5 cards.

attacks.name: Thunder Blast
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

flavorText: Although it’s called a guardian deity, if a person or Pokémon puts it in a bad mood, it will become a malevolent deity and attack.

name: Hop's Pincurchin ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Counterattack Quills
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), place 3 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spiky Thunder
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

name: Iono's Tadbulb
flavorText: Tadbulb shakes its tail to generate electricity. If it senses danger, it will make its head blink on and off to alert its allies.

name: Iono's Bellibolt ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Electric Streamer
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn, you may attach a Basic Lightning Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Iono's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thunderous Bolt
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

name: Iono's Wattrel

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

flavorText: When its wings catch the wind, the bones within produce electricity. This Pokémon dives into the ocean, catching prey by electrocuting them.

name: Iono's Kilowattrel

abilities.name: Flashing Draw
abilities.text: You must discard a Basic Lightning Energy from this Pokémon in order to use this Ability. Once during your turn, you may draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

flavorText: Kilowattrel inflates its throat sac to amplify its electricity. By riding the wind, this Pokémon can fly over 430 miles in a day.

name: Miraidon ex
rules: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent’s).
Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Hadron Spark
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon ex, this attack does 120 more damage.

name: Clefairy
flavorText: On nights with a full moon, they gather together and dance. The surrounding area is enveloped in an abnormal magnetic field.

name: Clefable

attacks.name: Metronome
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack.

flavorText: It has an acute sense of hearing. It can easily hear a pin being dropped nearly 1,100 yards away.

name: Lillie's Clefairy ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Fairy Zone
abilities.text: The Weakness of each of your opponent's Dragon Pokémon in play is now Psychic. (Apply Weakness as ×2.)

attacks.name: Full Moon Rondo
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).

name: Team Rocket's Exeggcute

attacks.name: Focused Wish
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

flavorText: Using telepathy only fellow Exeggcute can pick up on, they always form a cluster of six.

name: Team Rocket's Exeggutor

attacks.name: Tri Kinesis
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. If all of them are heads, Knock Out 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

flavorText: It is said that on rare occasions, one of its heads will drop off and continue on as an Exeggcute.

name: Team Rocket's Mewtwo ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Power Saver
abilities.text: This Pokémon can't attack unless you have 4 or more Team Rocket's Pokémon in play.

attacks.name: Erasure Ball
attacks.text: You may discard up to 2 Energy from your Benched Pokémon. This attack does 60 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.

name: Togepi
flavorText: The shell seems to be filled with joy. It is said that it will share good luck when treated kindly.

name: Togetic

attacks.name: Draining Kiss
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

flavorText: They say that it will appear before kindhearted, caring people and shower them with happiness.

name: Togekiss

abilities.name: Wonder Kiss
abilities.text: When your opponent's Active Pokémon is Knocked Out, flip a coin. If heads, take 1 more Prize card. The effect of Wonder Kiss doesn't stack.

flavorText: These Pokémon are never seen anywhere near conflict or turmoil. In recent times, they’ve hardly been seen at all.

name: Marill

attacks.name: Hide
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

flavorText: The oil-filled tail functions as a buoy, so it’s fine even in rivers with strong currents.

name: Azumarill ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Bubble Gathering
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn, you may use this Ability. Move an Energy from 1 of your other Pokémon to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Energized Balloon
attacks.text: This attack does 40 more damage for each Psychic Energy attached to this Pokémon.

name: Misdreavus

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: It loves to bite and yank people's hair from behind without warning, just to see their shocked reactions.

name: Mismagius

attacks.name: Assassin's Magic
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, place 6 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

flavorText: Its cries sound like incantations to torment the foe. It appears where you least expect it.

name: Ralts

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

flavorText: The horns on its head provide a strong power that enables it to sense people’s emotions.

name: Kirlia

attacks.name: Call Sign
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: It has a psychic power that enables it to distort the space around it and see into the future.

name: Mega Gardevoir ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Overflowing Wishes
attacks.text: For each of your Benched Pokémon, search your deck for a Basic Psychic Energy card and attach it to that Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Mega Symphonia
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each Psychic Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

name: Shuppet
flavorText: It loves to feed on feelings like envy and malice. Its upright horn catches the emotions of people.

name: Banette

attacks.name: Cursed Words
attacks.text: Your opponent chooses 3 cards from their hand and shuffles those cards into their deck.

flavorText: This Pokémon developed from an abandoned doll that amassed a grudge. It is seen in dark alleys.

name: Rotom

attacks.name: Roto Call
attacks.text: You may search your deck for any number of Pokémon that have "Rotom" in their name and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Gadget Show
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each Pokémon Tool attached to all of your Pokémon.

flavorText: Research continues on this Pokémon, which could be the power source of a unique motor.

name: Slurpuff
flavorText: It can distinguish the faintest of scents. It puts its sensitive sense of smell to use by helping pastry chefs in their work.

name: Hop's Phantump

attacks.name: Splashing Dodge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

flavorText: According to old tales, these Pokémon are stumps possessed by the spirits of children who died while lost in the forest.

name: Hop's Trevenant

attacks.name: Horrifying Revenge
attacks.text: If any of your Hop's Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does 100 more damage.

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

flavorText: Using its roots as a nervous system, it controls the trees in the forest. It’s kind to the Pokémon that reside in its body.

name: Team Rocket's Mimikyu

attacks.name: Gemstone Mimicry
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Tera Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack.

flavorText: This Pokémon lives in dark places untouched by sunlight. When it appears before humans, it hides itself under a cloth that resembles a Pikachu.

name: Spectrier

attacks.name: Phantasmal Barrage
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon and place 12 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

flavorText: It probes its surroundings with all its senses save one—it doesn’t use its sense of sight. Spectrier’s kicks are said to separate soul from body.

name: Munkidori

abilities.name: Adrena-Brain
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon has any Darkness Energy attached, you may move up to 3 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mind Bend
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: Munkidori keeps itself somewhere safe while it toys with its foes, using psychokinesis to induce intense dizziness.

name: Team Rocket's Diglett

attacks.name: Relentless Burrowing
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

flavorText: Its skin is very thin. If it is exposed to light, its blood heats up, causing it to grow weak.

name: Team Rocket's Dugtrio

abilities.name: Holes
abilities.text: Whenever your opponent's Active Pokémon moves to the Bench during their turn, place 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.

flavorText: In battle, it digs through the ground and strikes the unsuspecting foe from an unexpected direction.

name: Hitmontop

attacks.name: Spin and Draw
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 6 cards.

flavorText: It spins on its horn while dealing out elegant kicks. Its horn grows continuously through its lifetime.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Seventh Kick
attacks.text: If you don't have exactly 7 cards in your hand, this attack does nothing.

name: Lunatone

abilities.name: Lunar Cycle
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if you have Solrock in play, you may discard a Basic Fighting Energy card from your hand in order to use this Ability. Draw 3 cards. You can't use more than 1 Lunar Cycle Ability each turn.

flavorText: It was discovered at the site of a meteor strike 40 years ago. Its stare can lull its foes to sleep.

name: Solrock

attacks.name: Cosmic Beam
attacks.text: If you don't have Lunatone on your Bench, this attack does nothing. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

flavorText: Solar energy is the source of its power, so it is strong during the daytime. When it spins, its body shines.

name: Regirock ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Regi Charge
attacks.text: Attach up to 2 Basic Fighting Energy cards from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Giant Rock
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Stage 2 Pokémon, this attack does 140 more damage.

name: Groudon

attacks.name: Megaton Fall
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

flavorText: Said to have expanded the lands by evaporating water with raging heat. It battled titanically with Kyogre.

name: Cynthia's Gible

attacks.name: Rock Hurl
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

flavorText: It skulks in caves, and when prey or an enemy passes by, it leaps out and chomps them. The force of its attack sometimes chips its teeth.

name: Cynthia's Gabite

abilities.name: Champion's Call
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may search your deck for a Cynthia's Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: In rare cases, it molts and sheds its scales. Medicine containing its scales as an ingredient will make a weary body feel invigorated.

name: Cynthia's Garchomp ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Corkscrew Dive
attacks.text: You may draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Draconic Buster
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Riolu

attacks.name: Accelerating Stab
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Accelerating Stab.

flavorText: They communicate with one another using their auras. They are able to run all through the night.

name: Mega Lucario ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Aura Jab
attacks.text: Attach up to 3 Basic Fighting Energy cards from your discard pile to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Mega Brave
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Mega Brave.

name: Stunfisk ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Big Bite
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Flopping Trap
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 100 more damage.

name: Pancham

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: It does its level best to glare and pull a scary face, but it can’t help grinning if anyone pats its head.

name: Mega Hawlucha ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Tenacious Body
abilities.text: If this Pokémon would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, flip a coin. If heads, this Pokémon is not Knocked Out, and its remaining HP becomes 10.

attacks.name: Somersault Dive
attacks.text: If a Stadium is in play, this attack does 140 more damage. Then, discard that Stadium.

abilities.name: Double Type
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in play, it is Fighting and Psychic type.

attacks.name: Counter Jewel
attacks.text: If your opponent has 2 or fewer Prize cards remaining, this attack does 100 more damage.

name: Rolycoly
flavorText: Chunks of the surface of this Pokémon’s body that have grown old and flaked off have long been used for fuel as an alternative to coal.

name: Carkol

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: Due to the coal tar created inside it, the heap of coal on Carkol’s back never falls apart, even when the Pokémon rolls around at high speeds.

name: Coalossal

attacks.name: Tar Cannon
attacks.text: This attack does 140 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. If you don't have 10 or more Basic Fighting Energy cards in your discard pile, this attack does nothing. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Bulky Bump
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy from this Pokémon.

flavorText: It’s gentle usually but fearsome when angered. With a body that burns at over 2,700 degrees Fahrenheit, it crushes foes and turns them to ash.

name: Koraidon ex
rules: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent’s).
Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Orichalcum Fang
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does 120 more damage.

attacks.name: Impact Blow
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Impact Blow.

name: Okidogi

attacks.name: Settle the Score
attacks.text: This attack does 60 more damage for each Prize card your opponent took during their last turn.

flavorText: Okidogi is a ruffian with a short temper. It can pulverize anything by swinging around the chain on its neck.

name: Gastly
flavorText: It wraps its opponent in its gas-like body, slowly weakening its prey by poisoning it through the skin.

name: Haunter
flavorText: It likes to lurk in the dark and tap shoulders with a gaseous hand. Its touch causes endless shuddering.

name: Mega Gengar ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Shadowy Concealment
abilities.text: If 1 of your Darkness Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon ex, that player takes 1 fewer Prize card. The effect of Shadowy Concealment doesn't stack.

attacks.name: Void Gale
attacks.text: Move an Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Team Rocket's Murkrow

attacks.name: Deceit
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Torment
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks. During your opponent's next turn, that Pokémon can't use that attack.

flavorText: Feared and loathed by many, it is believed to bring misfortune to all those who see it at night.

name: Team Rocket's Honchkrow

attacks.name: Rocket Feathers
attacks.text: You may discard any number of Supporter cards that have "Team Rocket" in their name from your hand, and this attack does 60 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

flavorText: A single cry from this nocturnal Pokémon, and more than 100 of its Murkrow cronies will assemble.

name: Poochyena

attacks.name: Gnaw Off
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

flavorText: A Pokémon with a persistent nature, it chases its chosen prey until the prey becomes exhausted.

name: Mightyena

attacks.name: Kick Away
attacks.text: Switch out your opponent's Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)

flavorText: It will always obey the commands of a skilled Trainer. Its behavior arises from its living in packs in ancient times.

name: Galarian Zigzagoon
flavorText: Its restlessness has it constantly running around. If it sees another Pokémon, it will purposely run into them in order to start a fight.

name: Galarian Linoone
flavorText: It uses its long tongue to taunt opponents. Once the opposition is enraged, this Pokémon hurls itself at the opponent, tackling them forcefully.

name: Galarian Obstagoon

attacks.name: Scarring Shout
attacks.text: This attack does 70 damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Punk Smash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

flavorText: Its voice is staggering in volume. Obstagoon has a tendency to take on a threatening posture and shout—this move is known as Obstruct.

name: Cynthia's Spiritomb

attacks.name: Raging Curse
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage for each damage counter on all of your Benched Cynthia's Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness.

flavorText: Its constant mischief and misdeeds resulted in it being bound to an Odd Keystone by a mysterious spell.

name: Scraggy

attacks.name: Knock Off
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

flavorText: Its skin has a rubbery elasticity, so it can reduce damage by defensively pulling its skin up to its neck.

name: Mega Scrafty ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Counterattacking Crest
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), place 5 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Outlaw Leg
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand. Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

name: N's Zorua
flavorText: It changes into the forms of others to surprise them. Apparently, it often transforms into a silent child.

name: N's Zoroark ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Trade
abilities.text: You must discard a card from your hand in order to use this Ability. Once during your turn, you may draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Night Joker
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your Benched N's Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack.

name: Vullaby
flavorText: Its healthy appetite leads to visible growth spurts. It often has to replace the bones it wears as its size increases.

name: Mandibuzz ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Bone Shot
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Vulture Claw
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Master's Punch
attacks.text: If any of your Benched Pancham have any damage counters on them, this attack does 120 more damage.

name: Hoopa

attacks.name: Filch
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Knuckle Impact
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use attacks.

flavorText: This troublemaker sends anything and everything to faraway places using its loop, which can warp space.

name: Fezandipiti ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Flip the Script
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn, you may draw 3 cards. You can't use more than 1 Flip the Script Ability each turn.

attacks.name: Cruel Arrow
attacks.text: This attack does 100 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Pecharunt

abilities.name: Final Chain
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Mochi Rush
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Mochi Rush attack does 50 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: Its peach-shaped shell serves as storage for a potent poison. It makes poisonous mochi and serves them to people and Pokémon.

name: Mawile

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: Attached to its head is a huge set of jaws formed by horns. It can chew through iron beams.

name: Registeel ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Regi Charge
attacks.text: Attach up to 2 Basic Metal Energy cards from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Protecting Steel
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 50 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Pawniard

attacks.name: Push Down
attacks.text: Switch out your opponent's Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)

flavorText: Any chips in its blades would prove fatal for it. After each battle, it diligently maintains its blades using its favorite sharpening stone.

name: Bisharp

attacks.name: Rapid Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

flavorText: Bisharp mercilessly cuts its opponents to pieces with the sharp blades covering its body. It will do anything to win.

name: Kingambit

abilities.name: Supreme Overlord
abilities.text: Attacks used by this Pokémon do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon for each Prize card your opponent has taken (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Double-Edged Slash
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 50 damage to itself.

flavorText: Though it commands a massive army in battle, it’s not skilled at devising complex strategies. It just uses brute strength to keep pushing.

name: Togedemaru ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Stun Needle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Spiky Rolling
attacks.text: If this Pokémon used Spiky Rolling during your last turn, this attack does 80 more damage.

name: Dratini
flavorText: This Pokémon is full of life energy. It continually sheds its skin and grows steadily larger.

name: Dragonair

abilities.name: Evolutionary Guidance
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon has any Energy attached, you may use this Ability. Search your deck for an Evolution Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: Its crystalline orbs appear to give this Pokémon the power to freely control the weather.

name: Mega Dragonite ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Sky Transport
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may use this Ability. Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Ryuno Glide
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Rayquaza

attacks.name: Breakthrough Assault
attacks.text: If this Pokémon moved from your Bench to the Active Spot this turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

flavorText: It lives in the ozone layer far above the clouds and cannot be seen from the ground.

name: N's Reshiram

attacks.name: Powerful Rage
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

flavorText: According to myth, if people ignore truth and let themselves become consumed by greed, Reshiram will arrive to burn their kingdoms down.

name: N's Zekrom

attacks.name: Shred
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rampaging Thunder
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use attacks.

flavorText: When the interior part of its tail spins like a motor, Zekrom can generate many bolts of lightning to blast its surroundings.

name: Noibat

attacks.name: Knickknack Carrying
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon Tool card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: Even a robust wrestler will become dizzy and unable to stand when exposed to its 200,000-hertz ultrasonic waves.

name: Noivern

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Enhanced Blade
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool attached, this attack does 70 more damage.

flavorText: They fly around on moonless nights and attack careless prey. Nothing can beat them in a battle in the dark.

name: Dreepy
flavorText: It has a habit of biting at Clauncher even though it doesn’t feed on them. This is said to be vestigial behavior from when Dreepy was alive.

name: Drakloak

abilities.name: Recon Directive
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may look at the top 2 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Put the other card on the bottom of your deck.

flavorText: This Pokémon stores up energy in its lungs, then shoots it out. It takes care of Dreepy and battles alongside them until they’re all grown up.

name: Dragapult ex
rules: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent’s).
Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Phantom Dive
attacks.text: Put 6 damage counters on your opponent's Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

flavorText: All it does is sleep during the daytime. At night, it patrols its territory with its eyes aglow.

name: Team Rocket's Kangaskhan ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Comet Punch
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Wicked Impact
attacks.text: If you played a Supporter card that has "Team Rocket" in its name from your hand during this turn, this attack does 100 more damage.

name: Larry's Dunsparce

attacks.name: Rising Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

flavorText: If spotted, it escapes by burrowing with its tail. It can float just slightly using its wings.

name: Larry's Dudunsparce ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Work Rush
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 80 damage for each heads.

name: Skitty
flavorText: It can’t stop itself from chasing moving things, and it runs in a circle, chasing its own tail.

name: Delcatty

attacks.name: Energy Crush
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage for each Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon.

flavorText: It dislikes dirty places. It often searches for a comfortable place in which to groom itself.

name: Zangoose ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Spike Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Wild Scissors
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

name: Larry's Starly

attacks.name: Minor Errand-Running
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: Because they are weak individually, they form groups. However, they bicker if the group grows too big.

name: Larry's Staravia
flavorText: They maintain huge flocks, although fierce scuffles break out between various flocks.

name: Larry's Staraptor

attacks.name: Facade
attacks.text: If this Pokémon is Burned or Poisoned, this attack does 100 more damage.

attacks.name: Feathery Strike
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon, and this attack also does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: It never stops attacking even if it is injured. It fusses over the shape of its comb.

name: Fan Rotom

abilities.name: Fan Call
abilities.text: Once during your first turn, you may search your deck for up to 3 Colorless Pokémon with 100 HP or less, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. You can't use more than 1 Fan Call Ability during your turn.

attacks.name: Assault Landing
attacks.text: If there is no Stadium in play, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: There are several appliances that Rotom can inspirit, but the first one to be developed was the electric fan.

name: Mega Audino ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Kaleidowaltz
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, search your deck for up to 2 Basic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Ear Force
attacks.text: This attack does 80 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Larry's Rufflet

attacks.name: Peck the Wound
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 80 more damage.

flavorText: With its sharp claws, this Pokémon pierces its prey, and then it pecks at them. Although it also consumes berries, it’s a carnivore at heart.

name: Larry's Braviary

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Brave Bird
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

flavorText: For the sake of its friends, this brave warrior of the sky will not stop battling, even if injured.

name: Larry's Komala

abilities.name: Lethargic Charge
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may use this Ability. Attach an Energy card from your hand to your Active Larry's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dozing Draw
attacks.text: This Pokémon is now Asleep. Draw 2 cards.

flavorText: A potent anesthetic can be made by diluting Komala’s drool. This anesthetic was used for surgeries in the past.

name: Drampa

attacks.name: Dragon Strike
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Dragon Strike.

flavorText: It has a compassionate personality, but if it is angered, it completely destroys its surroundings with its intense breath.

name: Hop's Cramorant

attacks.name: Fickle Spitting
attacks.text: If your opponent doesn't have exactly 3 or 4 Prize cards remaining, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: Cramorant instinctively swallow everything whole. They’re at their most formidable when they’re struggling to swallow overly large prey.

name: Terapagos

attacks.name: Prism Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Basic Energy cards of different types and attach them to your Tera Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: The shell is made of crystallized Terastal energy. When struck by a move, this shell absorbs the move’s energy and transfers it to Terapagos.

name: Terapagos ex
rules: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent’s).
Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Unified Beatdown
attacks.text: If you go second, you can't use this attack during your first turn. This attack does 30 damage for each of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Crown Opal
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Basic non-Colorless Pokémon.

name: Acerola's Mischief
rules: You can use this card only if your opponent has 2 or fewer Prize cards remaining.  Choose 1 of your Pokémon in play. During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to that Pokémon by your opponent's Pokémon ex.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Air Balloon
rules: The Retreat Cost of the Pokémon this card is attached to is ColorlessColorless less.
You may attach any number of Pokémon Tools to your Pokémon during your turn. You may attach only 1 Pokémon Tool to each Pokémon, and it stays attached.

name: Anthea & Concordia
rules: You can use this card only if you have N's Darmanitan, N's Zoroark ex, N's Vanilluxe, N's Klinklang, N's Reshiram, and N's Zekrom in play.  During this turn, if your opponent's Active Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an attack used by your N's Pokémon, take 3 more Prize cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Boss's Orders
rules: Switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Buddy-Buddy Poffin
rules: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon with 70 HP or less and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Canari
rules: You can use this card only if you discard another card from your hand.  Search your deck for up to 4 Lightning Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Counter Gain
rules: If you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent, attacks used by the Pokémon this card is attached to cost Colorless less.
You may attach any number of Pokémon Tools to your Pokémon during your turn. You may attach only 1 Pokémon Tool to each Pokémon, and it stays attached.

name: Fighting Gong
rules: Search your deck for a Basic Fighting Energy card or a Basic Fighting Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Forest of Vitality
rules: Each player's Grass Pokémon can evolve into Grass Pokémon during the turn they play those Pokémon, except during their first turn.
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can’t be played.

name: Glass Trumpet
rules: You can use this card only if you have any Tera Pokémon in play.  Choose up to 2 of your Benched Colorless Pokémon and attach a Basic Energy card from your discard pile to each of them.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Iris's Fighting Spirit
rules: You can use this card only if you discard another card from your hand.  Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Light Ball
rules: Attacks used by the Pikachu ex this card is attached to do 50 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon ex (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may attach any number of Pokémon Tools to your Pokémon during your turn. You may attach only 1 Pokémon Tool to each Pokémon, and it stays attached.

name: Lillie's Determination
rules: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 6 cards. If you have exactly 6 Prize cards remaining, draw 8 cards instead.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Mega Signal
rules: Search your deck for a Mega Evolution Pokémon ex, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Mystery Garden
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may discard an Energy card from their hand in order to draw cards until they have as many cards in their hand as they have Psychic Pokémon in play.
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can’t be played.

name: N's PP Up
rules: Attach a Basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched N's Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Night Stretcher
rules: Put a Pokémon or a Basic Energy card from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Nighttime Mine
rules: Attacks used by each Tera Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) cost Colorless more.
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can’t be played.

name: Poké Pad
rules: Search your deck for a Pokémon that doesn't have a Rule Box, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. (Pokémon ex, Pokémon V, etc. have Rule Boxes.)
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Premium Power Pro
rules: During this turn, attacks used by your Fighting Pokémon do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Surfer
rules: Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, draw cards until you have 5 cards in your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Team Rocket's Archer
rules: You can use this card only if any of your Team Rocket's Pokémon were Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn.  Each player shuffles their hand into their deck. Then, you draw 5 cards, and your opponent draws 3 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Team Rocket's Ariana
rules: Draw cards until you have 5 cards in your hand. If all of your Pokémon in play are Team Rocket's Pokémon, draw cards until you have 8 cards in your hand instead.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Team Rocket's Factory
rules: Once during each player's turn, if they played a Supporter card that has "Team Rocket" in its name from their hand this turn, they may draw 2 cards.
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can’t be played.

name: Team Rocket's Giovanni
rules: Switch your Active Team Rocket's Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Team Rocket's Pokémon. If you do, switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Team Rocket's Great Ball
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for an Evolution Team Rocket's Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If tails, search your deck for a Basic Team Rocket's Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Team Rocket's Hypnotizer
rules: If the Team Rocket's Pokémon this card is attached to is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon (even if this Team Rocket's Pokémon is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Asleep.
You may attach any number of Pokémon Tools to your Pokémon during your turn. You may attach only 1 Pokémon Tool to each Pokémon, and it stays attached.

name: Team Rocket's Petrel
rules: Search your deck for a Trainer card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Team Rocket's Proton
rules: If you go first, you may use this card during your first turn.  Search your deck for up to 3 Basic Team Rocket's Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Team Rocket's Transceiver
rules: Search your deck for a Supporter card that has "Team Rocket" in its name, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Team Rocket's Watchtower
rules: Colorless Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) have no Abilities.
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can’t be played.

name: Thick Scale
rules: The Dragon Pokémon this card is attached to takes 50 less damage from attacks from your opponent's Grass, Fire, Water, or Lightning Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may attach any number of Pokémon Tools to your Pokémon during your turn. You may attach only 1 Pokémon Tool to each Pokémon, and it stays attached.

name: Tool Scrapper
rules: Choose up to 2 Pokémon Tools attached to Pokémon (yours or your opponent's) and discard them.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Ultra Ball
rules: You can use this card only if you discard 2 other cards from your hand. Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Urbain
rules: Draw 3 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Waitress
rules: Look at the top 6 cards of your deck and attach a Basic Energy card you find there to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Prism Energy
rules: As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides Colorless Energy.  If this card is attached to a Basic Pokémon, this card provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time.

name: Team Rocket's Energy
rules: This card can only be attached to a Team Rocket's Pokémon. If this card is attached to anything other than a Team Rocket's Pokémon, discard this card.  As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides 2 in any combination of Psychic Energy and Darkness Energy.

name: Erika's Tangela

abilities.name: Gathering of Blossoms
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may use this Ability. Search your deck for an Erika's Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Hidden beneath a tangle of vines that grows nonstop even if the vines are torn off, this Pokémon’s true appearance remains a mystery.

name: Beautifly

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Energy Straw
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand, and this attack does 80 damage for each Energy card you find there.

flavorText: Vibrantly patterned wings are its prominent feature. It sucks sweet flower nectar with its long mouth.

name: Dustox

abilities.name: Boisterous Wind
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may use this Ability. Flip a coin. If heads, put an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon into their hand.

attacks.name: Twilight Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

flavorText: A nocturnal Pokémon. Drawn by streetlights, they messily eat the leaves of trees lining boulevards.

name: Budew

attacks.name: Itchy Pollen
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, they can't play any Item cards from their hand.

flavorText: The pollen it releases contains poison. If this Pokémon is raised on clean water, the poison’s toxicity is increased.

name: Ethan's Magcargo

abilities.name: Melt Away
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has no Energy attached, it has no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Lava Burst
attacks.text: Discard up to 5 Fire Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 70 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

flavorText: This Pokémon lives near the craters of volcanoes. It stores fire energy in its shell of cooled and hardened magma.

name: Numel

abilities.name: Incandescent Body
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Burned.

flavorText: The magma in its body reaches 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit. Its hump gets smaller when it uses Fire-type moves.

name: Salazzle

attacks.name: Sudden Scorching
attacks.text: Your opponent discards a card from their hand. If this Pokémon evolved from Salandit during this turn, your opponent discards 2 more cards.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

flavorText: When two Salazzle meet, they will use their pheromone gas to fight over the males in each other’s group.

name: Scorbunny

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

flavorText: Fire energy gathers in the pads of its feet, raising their temperature. Once hot, Scorbunny’s footpads can deal heavy damage to opponents.

name: Psyduck

abilities.name: Damp
abilities.text: Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) lose any Ability that requires the Pokémon using it to Knock Out itself.

flavorText: It is constantly wracked by a headache. When the headache turns intense, it begins using mysterious powers.

name: Snorunt
flavorText: In some snowy lands, certain folklore says a house will prosper if a Snorunt lives there.

name: Weavile

attacks.name: Hail Claw
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon. Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: They travel in groups of four or five, leaving signs for one another on trees and rocks. They bring down their prey with coordinated attacks.

name: Heliolisk

abilities.name: Frilled Generator
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if you played Canari from your hand this turn, you may use this Ability. Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Lightning Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Powerful Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 70 damage for each heads.

flavorText: They flare their frills and generate energy. A single Heliolisk can generate sufficient electricity to power a skyscraper.

name: Vikavolt

attacks.name: Volt Switch
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Lightning Pokémon.

flavorText: When carrying a Charjabug, Vikavolt can receive electricity from it and then rapidly fire powerful electromagnetic beams from its large jaws.

name: Iono's Wattrel

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

flavorText: When its wings catch the wind, the bones within produce electricity. This Pokémon dives into the ocean, catching prey by electrocuting them.

name: Marill

attacks.name: Hide
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

flavorText: The oil-filled tail functions as a buoy, so it’s fine even in rivers with strong currents.

name: Misdreavus

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: It loves to bite and yank people’s hair from behind without warning, just to see their shocked reactions.

name: Banette

attacks.name: Cursed Words
attacks.text: Your opponent chooses 3 cards from their hand and shuffles those cards into their deck.

flavorText: This Pokémon developed from an abandoned doll that amassed a grudge. It is seen in dark alleys.

name: Togekiss

abilities.name: Wonder Kiss
abilities.text: When your opponent's Active Pokémon is Knocked Out, flip a coin. If heads, take 1 more Prize card. The effect of Wonder Kiss doesn't stack.

flavorText: These Pokémon are never seen anywhere near conflict or turmoil. In recent times, they’ve hardly been seen at all.

name: Slurpuff
flavorText: It can distinguish the faintest of scents. It puts its sensitive sense of smell to use by helping pastry chefs in their work.

name: Hop's Trevenant

attacks.name: Horrifying Revenge
attacks.text: If any of your Hop's Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does 100 more damage.

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

flavorText: Using its roots as a nervous system, it controls the trees in the forest. It’s kind to the Pokémon that reside in its body.

name: Team Rocket's Mimikyu

attacks.name: Gemstone Mimicry
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Tera Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack.

flavorText: This Pokémon lives in dark places untouched by sunlight. When it appears before humans, it hides itself under a cloth that resembles a Pikachu.

name: Team Rocket's Dugtrio

abilities.name: Holes
abilities.text: Whenever your opponent's Active Pokémon moves to the Bench during their turn, place 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.

flavorText: In battle, it digs through the ground and strikes the unsuspecting foe from an unexpected direction.

name: Hitmontop

attacks.name: Spin and Draw
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 6 cards.

flavorText: It spins on its horn while dealing out elegant kicks. Its horn grows continuously through its lifetime.

attacks.name: Seventh Kick
attacks.text: If you don't have exactly 7 cards in your hand, this attack does nothing.

abilities.name: Double Type
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in play, it is Fighting and Psychic type.

attacks.name: Counter Jewel
attacks.text: If your opponent has 2 or fewer Prize cards remaining, this attack does 100 more damage.

name: Mightyena

attacks.name: Kick Away
attacks.text: Switch out your opponent's Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)

flavorText: It will always obey the commands of a skilled Trainer. Its behavior arises from its living in packs in ancient times.

name: Cynthia's Spiritomb

attacks.name: Raging Curse
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage for each damage counter on all of your Benched Cynthia's Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness.

flavorText: Its constant mischief and misdeeds resulted in it being bound to an Odd Keystone by a mysterious spell.

name: Galarian Obstagoon

attacks.name: Scarring Shout
attacks.text: This attack does 70 damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Punk Smash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

flavorText: Its voice is staggering in volume. Obstagoon has a tendency to take on a threatening posture and shout—this move is known as Obstruct.

name: Mawile

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: Attached to its head is a huge set of jaws formed by horns. It can chew through iron beams.

name: Dreepy
flavorText: It has a habit of biting at Clauncher even though it doesn’t feed on them. This is said to be vestigial behavior from when Dreepy was alive.

name: Drakloak

abilities.name: Recon Directive
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may look at the top 2 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Put the other card on the bottom of your deck.

flavorText: This Pokémon stores up energy in its lungs, then shoots it out. It takes care of Dreepy and battles alongside them until they’re all grown up.

name: Larry's Staraptor

attacks.name: Facade
attacks.text: If this Pokémon is Burned or Poisoned, this attack does 100 more damage.

attacks.name: Feathery Strike
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon, and this attack also does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: It never stops attacking even if it is injured. It fusses over the shape of its comb.

name: Fan Rotom

abilities.name: Fan Call
abilities.text: Once during your first turn, you may search your deck for up to 3 Colorless Pokémon with 100 HP or less, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. You can't use more than 1 Fan Call Ability during your turn.

attacks.name: Assault Landing
attacks.text: If there is no Stadium in play, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: There are several appliances that Rotom can inspirit, but the first one to be developed was the electric fan.
